content.rendered:
The team at AqualisBraemar shares the passion, vision and values for working in energy and the world’s oceans, de-risking and driving the energy transition. We are driven by the idea that the best work is born from professionalism, diligence… and fun. You know AqualisBraemar, but do you know our team?

Wayne Neves, Chief Surveyor | Middle East & India 

What do you do at AqualisBraemar?

I am the chief surveyor for the Marine business line, for the Middle East and India region. I deal with marine casualty surveys as well as other marine insurance matters for hull and machinery underwriters, P&I clubs, shipowners, charterers and brokers. I am based in Dubai and lead a team of staff master mariner and marine engineer surveyors that are based in the Middle East. My main job is ensuring all instructions are attended to by the surveyor with the most suitable skill set for the case. All reporting to our Principals is done through me to ensure quality and consistency in reporting is maintained to the highest standard.

What excites you the most about our industry?

Whilst we mostly deal in casualty work, we do carry out risk assessment surveys quite regularly. These surveys are designed to try to minimise risk to underwriters taking new tonnage on cover. However, they also serve as a platform to enable seafarers to get the necessary support from the owners/managers with regards to supplying stores and equipment to the vessel to keep the vessels safe and at a high standard.

What made you join AqualisBraemar?

I joined BMT Marine & Offshore surveys back in 2009 and have found no reason to move through the various transitions the company has made up to date. The AqualisBraemar name remains the reference in terms of survey quality, which is something to be proud of and something that drives me to maintain.

What do you do when you are not working?

I am a husband and father of three daughters. Family time is important to me as I spent quite a long time away from them during my seagoing career. We enjoy exploring new places together as a family to create memories and stories to tell in later years. I enjoy working with my hands and DIY is something I enjoy doing. I am a keen motorsport fan and also enjoy taking my car to the track for a bit of a spin on occasion.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Meet the Team: Capt. Sandeep Sharma
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: “I handle the country operations for India, whereby my role entails me to liaise with clients and partners to reach newer heights.”

jetpack-related-posts.title: Meet the Team: Mark McGurran
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: My title is Global Managing Director for Marine at AqualisBraemar. That role involves driving the business forward, ensuring we attract and retain the correct calibre and character of staff on our team and developing the high-level business strategy.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Meet the Team: Romen Cross
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: “I am the US West Coast engineering surveyor, based in the Seattle area. I typically work up and down the coast, along with Mexico, Western Canada, Hawaii, and Alaska.”

jetpack-related-posts.title: Meet the Team: Pradeep Padman
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: “As a Lead Naval Architect based in Dubai office, I look after the Engineering and Marine Warranty Services in the Middle East region.”

jetpack-related-posts.title: Meet the Team: Capt. Deddy Setiyatno
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: The team at AqualisBraemar share the passion, vision and values for working in energy and the world’s oceans, de-risking and driving the energy transition. We are driven by the idea that the best work is born from professionalism, diligence… and fun.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Meet the Team: Ashanti Storr
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: “I assist with vessel inspections alongside experienced naval architects, ex-chief engineers, and master mariners both locally and internationally.”
